website_summaries.verdict: With proper care, this spacious, affordable feeder is a great choice for observing hummingbirds and saving a few dollars.
pros: A classic design with all the features you need to attract numerous hummingbirds – spacious 32 oz
capacity, 10 yellow flower feeding ports, and 360 degree perch
cons: Care must be taken to attach the lid properly, otherwise leaks may occur or the jar may fall off
Ants can easily get into the feeder

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: After trying to use it for 2 seasons I just threw it away. The first year, the top came off so I tried to glue it with super glue. That didn't work so I used my glue gun. It lasted the rest of last summer. This summer, the first thing when I filled it up it came apart again dumping all the Hummingbird food. So, I glued it with JB Weld and it didn't hold at all. I didn't want to use a hot glue gun again because it didn't last and because of the heat. So... I put it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: RachelNM

customer_reviews.title: Hummers love these
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for several years. I have 5 I put out every year. My hummers can empty all 5 in 1 day. They are durable unless your puppy eats them ! Even when these swing in the wind the hummers hang on. I must get at least 100 hummers every year. This includes the babies. These are also easy to clean. Take them apart including popping off the yellow flowers, wash with hot water and q-tips, long handle brush and rinse, rinse, rinse.
customer_reviews.author: JacsBay

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Cheap plastic. Bottom breaks off from weight of liquid.
customer_reviews.text: Went outside to find an empty feeder. Took about a minute to realize it was due to the bottom portion breaking off. I had filled it with very expensive bottled nectar, which obviously all went to waste. I had an old glass feeder that was misplaced--never had any issue. This feeder is cheap thin plastic and I am more upset about the wasted nectar than the wasted money on this trash product. FYI: I considered a fat squirrel culprit; however, there is a 24x7 CCTV camera pointed at the feeder. Not caused by anything over than poor quality and gravity. Avoid. Buy a glass feeder.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Defective Failure
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these based on the reviews. I have been using them for two months. This morning the First Nature 3090 32-ounce Hummingbird Flower Feeder broke off from it's attachment and fell to the ground. I uprighted it and the clear plastic container opened up and spilled sugar water all over the cement. I can't trust that the other three will do the same. I spent $40.00 for these. These are defective.
customer_reviews.author: J. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: We had other types but they are so hard to keep clean I went searching. This one was listed as easy to clean on a hummingbird website so we got one. We have been so happy we have switched out all of our others for this model only. We now have 4 of these and they are really great. It keeps our hummingbirds fueled up so they can catch our country bugs. Gnats, mosquitos and other small bugs are seldom a problem for us anymore due to the feisty little hummers eating them. Hummingbirds are very beneficial insect hunters.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: The hummers love them
customer_reviews.text: All plastic and very easy to clean. They have a rest for the hummers to sit and drink. We have tried other feeders and these are the tops. Customer service is excellent. Do not put in dishwasher. It will destroy the globes and warp them. I called the company and purchased new globes at a very reasonable price. We have been using these for about 5 seasons now and have to add new ones every year, our population grows every year.
customer_reviews.author: houdoo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Big Feeder
customer_reviews.text: So many hummingbirds in the summer that the 8oz feeder was running out in one day. Some times there seven or eight bird at the feeder at the same time. This feeder is all plastic, but it's easy to clean, and seems unaffected by bleach to get rid of the mold that starts to collect on the surface. The little yellow flowers pop off to to clean more thoroughly. You do need a bottle brush to quickly and easily clean the inside of the bottle. BTW, if you really like the red coloring in the feeder, some solutions use carmine or hibiscus, but you don't need the red dye at all to attract hummingbirds.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Love the feeder, but it's not bee proof
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't wait to get these new feeders. They are very nice, and so easy to fill and clean. Now if someone can tell me how to keep the bees away, these feeders would be perfect. I'm going to try taking the yellow flowers off, but I don't think that's going to help. The bees apparently can reach the nectar, so I'm not sure what to do to deter them. Other than the bees, the feeder is great.
customer_reviews.author: EmilySunshine

customer_reviews.title: It's for the Birds
customer_reviews.text: Humming birds, that is. My wife has tried numerous units, ranging in prices from just under hiring a Kevin James (Zoo Keeper) to Walmart oriented. But this one has been the cat's meow (so to speak). Even the ants are conducting protest marches (as it doesn't leak all over the patio). There is one problem though... Typically, when a humming bird feeds off one of these, they will spread the word to others. Not our guy. He (Bogart, as we call him -- you know as in, "don't bogart that..., my firend...") has obviously not told a sole. As a matter of fact, he's gotten so fat he now has to use a drone to reach it. Video to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Renee

customer_reviews.title: You'll get hummingbirds!  You'll be amazed!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! A Texas friend informed me of these feeders -- she gets dozens of hummingbirds at a time. Mix 4 parts water to 1 part sugar, no food coloring needed, and you're good to go. The little yellow flowers on the base are only decoration, but they cause a problem -- mold/mildew forms under them. So use a kitchen knife, pop them off and throw them away -- obviously they do not serve to attract the hummingbirds because they still come to the feeder without them. That also makes it even easier to clean the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: The red cap detached, the feeder hit the ground and 32 ounces of sugar water splattered everywhere. Needs a better design. Didn't think about the weight of the water causing this to happen. With this current design, I wouldn't recommend purchasing. The hook on the red cap is very small and restrictive to where it will hang but that's an easy fix. WASTE OF MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Loved by the hummingbirds and the caretaker!
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy and pretty. I have critters who have knocked the feeders to the ground...& they remained intact even when hit rocks. One issue...the raccoons I suspect...knocked a few of the yellow plastic flowers around the ports off...sweat bees have no problem going in thru the ports. I bought 1 year apart, and the 2 open differently. Cleaning is ok. I use 3 brushes to make sure all nooks & crannies are clean. It’s lots of fun to watch the hummingbirds drink...beautiful birds
customer_reviews.author: Jen C

customer_reviews.title: More birds...
customer_reviews.text: I know it says 32oz, but it is still larger than what I normally use. It is made entirely of plastic, which is ok for me because its easier to clean than my smaller glass feeders. I bought this one because it has a perch, I like my hummingbirds to hang out, not just drink and buzz away. What I didn't expect was the additional larger birds (primarily Finches). I'm guessing because the perch and overall size accommodates them as well. I don't mind them, but if you don't want other visitors, get something smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Darcie

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Been using it all summer. Have a LOT of hummingbirds - usually refill every couple of days. Easy to clean - EXCEPT around those yellow flowers. Mold tends to flourish - hot temps, always wet, very high sugar content. Almost a given, there will be mold. So, I use a pipe cleaner to keep all the access points clear of mold. The problem with the yellow flowers is that the mold grows underneath them. When you push the pipe cleaner under the flower, it tends to pop off. It goes right back on easily, but tends to lose its grip after its been popped off repeatedly for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Dandee Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: Attracts Hummingbirds - All Day, Every Day!
customer_reviews.text: I acquired this as a gift for my hubby, because our "more attractive" hummingbird feeder (with a classy-looking copper finish) never seemed to draw hummingbirds. Hubby hung a strip of red cloth above the copper-colored feeder to test the theory that red attracts 'birds, and we witnessed a 'bird trying to feed on the red cloth itself!, That sealed the deal: I ordered this bright red feeder that very day! Since we filled and installed this feeder (a very simple process), we've had hummingbirds visit it frequently throughout every day. It's nearly magical and it brings us so much joy!
customer_reviews.author: C. Fenzl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, large capacity
customer_reviews.text: This is a great feeder. The size allows for many more feeding points than some that opt for bigger individual flowers. It also disassembles easily for cleaning. The first few times it can be stiff going back together, but after that it’s easy, but firm enough to not cause worry about it slipping while hanging. If you have a lot of hummers that are draining your feeders quickly, this one holds a substantial amount of nectar (I only fill it half full) and could ease your burden.
customer_reviews.author: J. DeSimone

customer_reviews.title: Ok feeders but you have to tap them every day
customer_reviews.text: These are ok hummingbird feeders. They would be 5 star except they tend to get air locked and the nectar won’t go into the bottom. You have to tap them to get the air bubbles out of the bottom and when you do that a little bit of nectar will leak from around the seam where the 2 bottom pieces meet. If you don’t clean that off the bees and yellow jackets will show up and keep the hummingbirds away. I have to tap mine every morning or there isn’t any nectar in the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M

customer_reviews.title: best hummingbird feeder - good vendor
customer_reviews.text: large capacity - only need to fill it twice a week (morning and evening we get SWARMS of hummers on each feeder). Cleanable - completely disassembles, no hidden cavitites that can't be cleaned; top-shelf dishwasher. First set of three unblemished after 3 seasons; I now own seven of these, and am going to buy four more (as a four pack - cheapest). Retiring and gifting (to Goodwill) all other varieties of feeders. Though I almost never buy something not fulfilled by Amazon (or Prime), the shipping was quick from vendor and am purchasing from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Humming birds Love It!
customer_reviews.text: The Humming birds love this Nectar feeder. It is only made of plastic so will only last between 5 and 8 years due to the Suns UV. That's fine by me as it is very cheap! It is made very well and no leaks and easy to clean. Holds a good amount of Nectar so it lasts quite a long time between fills. We live in Southern California and we can get as many as 6 Hummers feeding here. The perch is just right and the Hummers will perch and feed with ease. I Love this Feeder. Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These are very standard hummingbird feeders, and are fine. However, apparently larger birds are using them and the little yellow flowers around the drinking points are popping off. Easy to clean, which is important, because this is Florida and I have to change the water every couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: besshRdwick

customer_reviews.title: My favorite feeders!
customer_reviews.text: Ten feeding ports provide a lot of space for my Hummers to congregate at these feeders. I have a lot of Hummers and the size helps to only have to fill these feeders once each day. I keep a set of clean feeders in the house and simply switch them out every day as they become empty. They are easy to open and close, and easy to clean; note...the flowers snap off and on for cleaning. I recommend buying a small cleaning brush for the feeding ports (the size of a mascara brush) and a bigger bottle brush for the storage bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Durham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feeder- no leaking.
customer_reviews.text: Love this feeder. After trying multiple feeders that all leaked, I bought this one. It never leaks. In the evenings I have 7-9 hummingbirds feeding on it all at the same time. They love it. I would definitely recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Received the wrong ones!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. I order the two pack of the First Nature feeder with the yellow flowers and received totally different feeders. The ones I received don't have the ant moat on it like the one with the yellow flowers plus the hole openings on the ones I receive are too big and wasps can crawl in. I know this because I already have one of these and one of the ones with as pictured with the flowers. The pictured one is a decent feeder, but unfortunately they sent me the wrong ones. Sending them back!
customer_reviews.author: Dginthed

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds love them but there is a design flaw that makes it fall.
customer_reviews.text: I have six feeders. This is one of their favorites. I have just updated this review. The top comes off over time. It's not screwed on - just fitted. The idea that it can be removed for cleaning is great, but in less than a year I have had a few of them fall off with just the top red part hanging. I added duct tape around the top edge of the container and that solved the problem but in the process I have lost several of the flowers. I love the fact that everything comes apart for cleaning but the design needs to be fixed so the top is screwed on.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B

customer_reviews.title: Reservoir falls off when filled and hung
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought these feeders were similar to one I already was using. But now that I've had them outside, I'm realizing a defect in the way they're made. The top cover barely snaps over the nectar container so when filled and hung, the weight of the feeder makes it disconnect from the top hanger and falls to the ground. The first time it happened I thought it was a fluke, it has now happened 2 days in a row. My original feeder connects securely to the top hanger. I'm regretting buying the 2 pack Do not waste your money on this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and low maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Never had one before so nothing to compare it too - but it's easy to clean, holds a lot, and within a day of it being up we saw hummingbirds. We dissolve 1c sugar in 4 cups water, and only fill a cup at a time (just store the rest in the fridge). These should be cleaned every other day or so to prevent mold and bacteria and harming the birds. We hang it from a carabiner on a 7ft garden steak so we can see it from our living room window. All-in-all we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder, but hurricanes killed all our hummers here....
customer_reviews.text: I love the feeder, but very sadly, our hummingbirds on our island are now extinct after Irma and Maria blasted us. It's been 7 months since seeing our hummingbirds daily. We have not seen one since Sept 6, 2017. My husband has seen one early on after the storms on the other end of our island. I just read an article that, for hummingbirds in the Caribbean, a loss of their flowers after storms can mean almost instant extinction. We are very sad and hope that eventually they will find their way back, although it's not looking good for our tiniest feathered friends. However, I'm sure they would love this feeder, as it's easy to clean and well made.
customer_reviews.author: T. Butler

customer_reviews.title: This were designed really well! Very happy with them!
customer_reviews.text: These feeders were designed very well. They have bee guards and ant guards built in. They only hold about 3 cups of mixture but I've used the larger ones and the mixture ends up starting to get a little mildewy toward the end so this actually is a good thing to refill them often. I ordered two and have them up together so they last a little longer. I also really like how easy to clean these are. I highly recommend them and we have a TON of hummies to feed here :)
customer_reviews.author: Pups Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good basic humming bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: It's slightly flimsy but works well, doesn't leak and the cute little guys come and use it frequently, even stopping to fully perch many times. You also don't have to worry about heavier birds and squirrels getting to it, so it doesn't need to be super sturdy. Also, humming birds need food over the winter really badly so these really help your local population! Having this 3 months now out in the rain and sun the plastic colors haven't faded at all either.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brown

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to clean “pop off” yellow flowers.
customer_reviews.text: Great size, and like the many feeding openings. However, I threw it away after a few months due to the difficulty cleaning. To keep the mold away you have to pop each little yellow flower off and take a tooth brush and Q-tip As well as taking the tooth brush & Q-tip to the base holes and then pop the yellow flowers back on. Too time consuming and too much trouble for me.
customer_reviews.author: Charmayne

customer_reviews.title: Good hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: I like the First Nature hummingbird feeders because they're one of the easiest to clean. I'd prefer glass over plastic for the top portion, but its other features keep me buying this and the smaller First Nature brand. The only drawback is that with the holes facing up, it appears that rainwater gets in and dilutes the sugar water. There's not much rain here, and ease of cleaning is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Pidges Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Leaks badly.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace one that leaked. Reviews are mixed so which do you believe. This leaked worse than the one I was replacing. Absolute garbage and shouldn't be allowed to sell. There are no threads connecting the base to the container, just arms on the perch that lock under tabs. $4 of nectar leaked out within hours.
customer_reviews.author: Winemaker949

customer_reviews.title: Feeder Does Not Perform Over Time
customer_reviews.text: I need to revise my previous review. We have never put these feeders in the dishwasher, but over time the reservoir bottle has separated twice from the red top, making a huge mess on the patio. Seems like this product starts out with a good performance, but deteriorates over time. Unfortunately I bought 3 of them and it is too late to return them. I also had problems with bees. They are not bee proof. Too bad because they are easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: SW Utah

customer_reviews.title: Not Good Quality?
customer_reviews.text: After a month of use, Hummingbirds do not feed from them; as compared to the "Glass Feeders". Filled these plastic feeders, at the same time and with the same liquid food, and the liquid turned grayish in a couple of days, while my old glass feeders stayed clear until they were emptied/sucked by the Hummingbirds. Unfortunately, my return warranty has expired seven (7) days ago. I'm glad that they were not expensive; otherwise I will be mad by buying these feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Mr FR

customer_reviews.title: My new  feeders are great.  Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: After my humming birds refused to drink out of the feeders that were made in china for some reason. I think that the chinese made feeders were leeching weird chemicals out of the plastic and the birds said "no way I is drinking that stuff". So I changed to these good looking made in the USA feeders and slowly but surely my little flock is returning to feast on the delicious sugar water.
customer_reviews.author: Pork Chop

customer_reviews.title: Huge bird feeder
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is huge. I love how it completely comes apart for easy cleaning. I like that it can feed more birds at at once than the others I have. My issue with it is how flimsy the main plastic container part is. I am a bit afraid that it will crumble or melt in the sun. I have been using it for a couple of weeks now and it seems to be holding up well. I will be getting more of them as they are by far the easiest to clean.
customer_reviews.author: IDesign

customer_reviews.title: The worst hummingbird feeder I've used
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable, generally well-reviewed hummingbird feeder. This one hit both those marks....but I'm not sure why. It is made of the cheapest, least durable plastic out there. But worst of all, it is SO incredibly difficult to open. This makes cleaning a nightmare. I broke 2 fingernails attempting to open either side of the lid. It is not well-made at all and I'd sooner get something at the dollar store. Unlike other reviewers, I didn't have issues with the hook breaking (though I could see that happening, because the hook is also made of very thin, floppy plastic).
customer_reviews.author: Wends

customer_reviews.title: Best hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is the best feeder I have had - this model is kind of hard to find. It is plastic. The top screws into the bottom. The bottom is made of two pieces and slides. Top and bottom are easy to clean; I use an old bottle brush to clean the top piece. It has a little tray area on top that I put water in to keep the ants from getting into the food.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: The Hummers love the container, and even took to nesting nearby.
customer_reviews.text: It worked so well I purchased a second one for out back. I was tired of replacing them all the time as they started to leak, some brand not even a season. If you want a smaller container, they make one: VERY easy to fill and use. It has an integrated hook on top which works in very strong winds. There is no need to mix the sugar water and then add it. The opening makes it easy enough to mix right in the container. Easy to open and clean, the underside of the bottom locks into place. Bottom Line: The Hummers love the container, and even took to nesting nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds seem to prefer this feeder over others I have had
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first feeder of this kind close to a year ago and noticed that Hummingbirds preferred it over another now-defunct feeder I had. I bought two more for a balcony. Let me tell you -- there isn't a minute in the day where I don't see hummingbirds when I look outside. The only thing -- don't expect these lovely creatures to share. I make my own hummingbird food and change it every other day. I don't think they prefer colored food better.
customer_reviews.author: RCutie86

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and it does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I already had a small glass hummingbird feeder but wanted to add a new one because of a problem with bees. The bee problem cleared up by itself, but I kept this large plastic feeder because it doesn't need to be refilled as frequently as the glass one. I would refill it more frequently in hot weather but, with fall coming, the water stays good longer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: This feeder is wide-mouthed and easy to fill and clean as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is wide-mouthed and easy to fill and clean as advertised. The base also comes apart for easy cleaning. I bought this feeder because it has 10 feeder ports and I wanted to accommodate more birds at one feeder. But, the photo is a bit deceptive. The 10 flowers (feeder ports) are much closer together than they appear. So close, in fact, that if 10 birds were all seated at once they would literally be shoulder-to-shoulder, and we all know how "tolerant" hummers are toward one another. IMO, the base needs to be wider and the ports need to be separated a little farther apart. Otherwise it appears to be an okay feeder. Personally, I still prefer glass though.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Thompson

customer_reviews.title: They dont work. Defect??
customer_reviews.text: They don't work. The Hummingbirds drink as they should. The level drops in the lower bowl until the birds cant reach the liquid anymore. The "bowl" does not re-fill, unless I "burp" the container by tilting it side to side, the air goes out and then the food fills the bowl. Is there a fix for this? Do I need to drill a hole some where? The First Nature 3055 32-ounce Hummingbird Feeder worked great, until we put them into the dishwasher at the end of the season. MY mistake.
customer_reviews.author: nert

customer_reviews.title: This is by far THE BEST one we've owned
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, we've owned various styles of hummingbird feeders from different manufacturers. This is by far THE BEST one we've owned. First of all, it's wide mouth (so it's easy to clean), the base comes apart (so its easier to clean and safer for the hummingbirds so you can ensure that bacteria and algae isn't building up inside). And to top it off, it has a reservoir at the top to put water so it discourages insects from climbing onto the feeder. We bought two of them -- and have DOZENS of hummingbirds in our backyard. So glad we took a chance this year and bought a different brand. A great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Magdi

customer_reviews.title: The hummingbirds are not attracted to this as they were ...
customer_reviews.text: The hummingbirds are not attracted to this as they were with the feeder it replaces. I use my old feeder next to this ione despite its cracked top. BTW unless this is completely empty (and it never is as the hummingbirds don't feed from it) it must be turned upside down to refill it allowing residual nectar to make a mess all over everythig. Looks cute, but I can only give it ONE star.
customer_reviews.author: Michael in Bothell

customer_reviews.title: hummingbirds do not like
customer_reviews.text: Oh my GOSH. Please don't waste your money. We have 2 of the MEKKA PRO hummingbird feeders. Decided to try these. Oh my, they say you get what you pay for. WOW. Same nectar in the feeders, same place in our windows. Everything the same. The hummingbirds tried for one second on to the others. We thought, what a bargain, 2 for the price of one. Now have to send them back. What a waste of time and money. Geez!!!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Marie Beeks

customer_reviews.title: Top falls off getting sugar water everywhere
customer_reviews.text: These are not like the ones I've bought over the past 12 years even though they look just like them...Bought 4 of these in May, it's September and now all four have had the top portion come off dropping all the sugar water all over everything! I used gorilla glue on 2 of them but the heat I guess didn't let that hold them either. My old ones are horribly faded and look bad but they don't fall apart! Guess like everything else..nothings made the way they use to be
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Have had two of these, have about 15 hummies, front /back, have had theses for literally years, finally the one in back broke and fully filled, big mess. Must be the season because everywhere I went they were out, thank God for Amazon, got it the very next day, happy camper again so are my hummies. I love this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large size and multiple ports.
customer_reviews.text: I like these feeder because of their simplicity and size. I don't need fancy. I just need large, easy clean feeder for my 40-50 hummers that spend their summers with us. We fill these larger feeder twice daily and would hate to have to fill the smaller ones 4-5 times a day. Need to know when we leave the hummers will have food until we get back. Like have multiple ports also.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Carter

customer_reviews.title: Very good bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these and they've always worked well for how inexpensive they are. The parts are all plastic and very easy to assemble and take apart for washing and/or filling. I've seen around eight birds at once sit on this thing so they seem to love it. I'd recommend hand washing this since it does come with a warning about using it in the dishwasher. As long as you're not expecting a lot for something that's under a twenty dollar bill, this should work well for you. Overall, I like it...and more importantly, the birds seem to like it as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cox

customer_reviews.title: I purchased a glass one on here that is great.
customer_reviews.text: Threw mine away. The top is just placed onto the bottom piece. When it is full it actually falls apart and the bottom falls to the ground. Plus bees are able to get through the holes so they also come in the house when you go to clean it out. I purchased a glass one on here that is great.
customer_reviews.author: k a

customer_reviews.title: Worst feeder we've ever had
customer_reviews.text: We've had multiple feeders over the years and while this was our newest one, it's the worst. We currently have 5 different kinds and the other 4 are far easier to clean. This one rapidly grows mold in spite of cleaning. It's difficult to disassemble to clean. The tiny floral ports attract mold and must be individually lifted off. Although we use the same nectar in all the feeders, the nectar in this feeder turns cloudy within days while the other feeders' nectar stays clear. On some days it leaks the nectar. It's way past the return time limit or we would.
customer_reviews.author: Carmel

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds were at it FIVE MINUTES after hanging it up!
customer_reviews.text: I love my hummingbirds and wanted to add a couple of extra feeders this year. My other feeders are glass, but I bought these for the price. They are very nice, obviously not as durable as glass, but they are still nice. As soon as I hung them up, the birds went to them. I have cleaned/refilled them several times this season, and they are still in perfect condition!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, and a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement to a similar hummingbird feeder, but this is night and day better 1) the base unscrews into two parts for easy cleaning. 2) the fluid reservoir has a wide mouth, making it easy to clean, easy to pour into. 3) the reservoir is really large. during high season, I fill it and dozens of hummies take 3-4 days to empty it. During the cooler off season, I fill it halfway and it lasts a week or more. 4) it has an integral ant moat in the top. 5) the yellow daisies are easy to clean. 6) I've had it for about 6 months now, and it's held up.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Birds don't seem to like it
customer_reviews.text: We got this feeder for its size to accommodate the number of birds frequenting our first feeder (which had only four stations). The first week seemed fine, birds were feeding regularly. But after about 3 weeks, visits dropped sharply, and the old 4 station feeder was much more heavily used. We washed and inspected the larger feeder, refilled it, and waited. Visits were infrequent. We have no idea what the problem might be. But we are disappointed with the results with this feeder. It is easy to clean and fill. It's just our birds don't seem to like it much.
customer_reviews.author: infoseeker

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good value but the body of the feeder just above the threads could use a little strengthening. If the thread is tightened even slightly, it feels like the body of the feeder will crush before the thread can be unscrewed. Otherwise it's a nice size, has a good perch ring and the base of the feeder comes apart easily for cleaning. I had to fabricate an S hook out of a thin metal rod because the supplied hanger would not fit my shepherd's crook style mount. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Eggo

customer_reviews.title: Not the product depicted in the photos
customer_reviews.text: This is not the hummingbird feeder shown in the photo. The one in the photo had a different shapes and has a different S shaped clip than the one I received. My friend ordered these and got a different product a few months ago than what I got. My clip broke within a minute of unboxing vs the hummingbird feeder shown in the Amazon photos have a metal portion of the clip that shouldn't break as easily. I'm keeping them because the general functionality of a hummingbird feeder is still there but I am definitely disappointed in how I got a product other than the one described by the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: This feeder is great for a large population of hummingbirds
customer_reviews.text: This unit is first class and Hummingbirds love it. If you have just one or two hummingbirds using your feeder, you might want a smaller one. The sugar water mixture gets old after 5 days. That's what we think due to our birds staying away if we don't clean and add new mixture every 4 or 5 days. We have friends who have 20 or 30 Hummingbirds using two of these feeders and they have to refill them twice daily. Those little birds can pack it away. In any case, there fun to watch.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyG

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought numerous hummingbird feeder‘s over the years and none of them have been very successful. This one had hammers all summer long. I like the fact that it has a slim railing around it where the birds can perch. The design of the others I have bought require the birds to stay in motion. I’ve never seen Hummers quiet before as they sit and sip.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: See the beauty of hummingbirds up close!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hummingbird feeder to hang outside my kindergarten classroom. It easily unscrewed to fill with sugar water. We easily closed it up with no spillage, hung it in a tree with some string. And the hummingbirds came almost Instantly! I think this may be a standard gift I give for the person who 'has everything '. We are delighted every time we see hummingbirds!
customer_reviews.author: dita

customer_reviews.title: best feeders i've found!
customer_reviews.text: this is the best hummingbird feeder i've come across: it doesn't leak, and it is SO easy to clean!! I've tried a few other feeders, but they either leaked, or were not as easy to clean, and cleanliness is a big thing when it comes to the hummies! i loved the first one so much, i bought another! Now i can still have one out while i clean and refill the other, so the easier/faster to clean, the better! (if i get more, i may as well buy the 2-pack next!)
customer_reviews.author: Kara V.

customer_reviews.title: It's blown down twice and it is still in great shape!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't put this up very well and it's blown down at least twice and there are no cracks or damage! It did land on grass and not a hard surface. I have another feeder that the birds don't like, but they took to this one right away. I love it and I love that it's a healthy size.
customer_reviews.author: P. Clare

customer_reviews.title: LOTS of HUMMINGBIRDS!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder can serve up to 5 birds at a time! Maybe it can serve more but that's the most I have seen at one time. It's easy to clean and holds a lot of nectar so you aren't refilling all the time. If you want humming birds, this feeder will get lots of them into your backyard!
customer_reviews.author: Busy Belle

customer_reviews.title: Just a Great Feeder
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to feeders for my many hummingbirds. They're easy to clean, sturdy for a few years, and the price point is great. I've not had many leaks which is important to me because of the enormous black ants I get. I certainly would recommend these feeders.
customer_reviews.author: CDWB

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best hummingbird feeders I've come across. Super easy to clean every part. Reservoir has a large opening to clean it. The whole thing is made of plastic, so no rusting. Perches for the birds (Still don't know why EVERY hummingbird feeder doesn't come with this). Reservoir on the top to place some water in to keep the ants out. Fill it and you don't have to mess with it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Lekberg

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious hummer feeding
customer_reviews.text: Bought this feeder because of the 10 feeding stations and "bee proof" flowers. Design is flawed because there is no way 10 birds can feed at once due to the small base. Birds often feed while hovering and with wings going about 4 birds are all that will fit. If base were bigger, might work, EXCEPT base doesn't fully empty when cleaning and there is no way base can be brushed clean. Bought 6 of these and wish I hadn't. We feed and band hummingbirds and use about 300 pounds of sugar annually. This feeder is not designed properly.
customer_reviews.author: Hummingbird Lady

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbird Fight Club
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I filled this feeder with sweet nectar and hung it, I've had a hummingbird fight club. They're constantly feeding and fighting for their turn to sip my sweet nectar. I suggest keeping the feeder clean, use fresh nectar (don't fill the feeder all the way up), and enjoy the chirps, swoop attacks, and bully birds!
customer_reviews.author: C. Griff

customer_reviews.title: RIP OFF HUMMINGBIRD FEEDERS-GOOD CUSTOMER VERY UPSET!
customer_reviews.text: These feeders were all DUDS!! After using them for about 1 1/2 months, they quit screwing together properly! I had them fall apart right as I was hanging them up! Sugar water went all over me! I am a VERY GOOD CUSTOMER! I spent $56.00 on these! Please do something! INFERIOR PRODUCT! CHEAP!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Cathy M. Quillen

customer_reviews.title: Works well but look for other features.
customer_reviews.text: When shopping for a feeder: 1. get one that is dishwasher resistant 2. You don't need more than a cup capacity. The nectar needs changing often. 3. buy one with a built-in ant trap. 4. Get one that is easy to disassemble and clean!
customer_reviews.author: Norm Stevens

customer_reviews.title: The best details in one feeder
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many styles of hummingbird feeders in the last 20 yrs. this has all the good parts in one. Wide mouth , sturdy & easy to clean, the yellow flower around ports discourage bees, I refer plastic as we have Bears that break the glass ones (These they don't destroy) & holds a lot of nectar. I add ant traps for best results.
customer_reviews.author: bee

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage....Don't Buy This Product
customer_reviews.text: Had less than a month. Top and bottom separate when hanging because this unit is not capable of supporting the weight of fluid when filled. Tried taping it together, that does not work. Missed return window by three days so stuck with this piece of garbage. Oh well, I guess you get what you pay for things still holds true.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Leaks. Pretty but not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these several years ago and this year decided to buy another one because the old one faded. Well the new one leaks so bad that I never have to worry about the nectar going bad had harming the little birds. I guess I'll be purchasing a different feeder this go round.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Great but BEES AND WASPS!
customer_reviews.text: So I loved the product. It's well made and it works. I have been using it for about 2 years BUT BEES! It's supposed to be designed to prevent bees from reaching the nectar. Well the do reach the nectar. The hummingbirds and the bees are ok but then wasps started appearing and this was an issue for me. I have small kids and would rather prevent an accident. Will probably be taking this down sadly.
customer_reviews.author: RobeGarza

customer_reviews.title: Transformed into a water container for birds of most sizes
customer_reviews.text: This hummingbird feeder did not work for the hummingbirds so it was transformed into a water container for birds, works like a champ, birds come every morning for a drink at the container, it turned out to be useful even if the hummingbirds did not like it
customer_reviews.author: No Body

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I have several hummer feeders. Poor luck in the past with larger ones (poorly made, would come apart when full, hard to clean, etc. This one is great. Plastic, but well made. Large opening in jar is easy to clean and fill. Base also easy to clean. The hummers like it and so do I. I may buy another and can definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CRR

customer_reviews.title: Good value but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good looking and good-sized IF you have more than 1 or 2 hummingbirds who visit, too large otherwise. No metal parts so no quick corrosion or having to scrap the feeder because of leaks caused by rust. I rated down one-star because the top red mount snaps onto the clear body and when debris gets into the space between the two, detaching the parts is risky business and one or both could break... at least in my clumsy hands.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H

customer_reviews.title: Harmful for hummingbirds because feeders can't be opened for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: The feeders have a defective design. They brake off the hook easily and can't be opened for cleaning. They need to be opened for cleaning, otherwise, the harmful bacteria can kill the birds. Please do not purchase it for hummingbirds because they can be killed by the bacteria from the feeder that's impossible to clean thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: TXHomeGrown

customer_reviews.title: they are terrific! I get 8 hummers at same time on ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these 1 month ago, they are terrific ! I get 8 hummers at same time on each. 32 oz. is fine but still have to fill them every 1 1/2 days, at least for now in the Pacific Northwest spring. Easy to clean in sink , not glass, no dishwasher , a snap to use after using one or 2 times. I easily popped off the yellow flower thingies,birds don't need them and its easier to rinse it off. There's enough red on these, so you don't need red coloring ( its not good for the hummers). Recommended to hummer lovers.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie K.

customer_reviews.title: great hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: Great hummingbird feeder! Sturdy and can be taken apart into 3 pieces, which makes it very easy to clean. More than 10 hummingbirds come to my house and drink from it everyday. Bought it for a few bucks when on sale, and can't be more happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: FH

customer_reviews.title: Happy hummers
customer_reviews.text: I bought a more expensive glass feeding container but the birds never came. This one works well and I have three birds using it if not scared off by a little female bird who feels that the container is her private property
customer_reviews.author: Tom from Santa Monica

customer_reviews.title: The transparent bottle part's wide mouth allows easy access for a cleaning brush
customer_reviews.text: Simple and well designed! This feeder is far easier to clean than the other half dozen or so that I've owned. The transparent bottle part's wide mouth allows easy access for a cleaning brush. The feeder part on the bottom disassembles into two pieces so the inside can be cleaned in a few seconds (the 1-piece kind takes several minutes and requires a small bottle brush, and even then there's usually mold/mildew left). The small water reservoir on top keeps ants out pretty well, but in hot weather in direct sun it dries out if you don't remember to refill it. and the fact that the feeding
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C

customer_reviews.title: The new favorite.
customer_reviews.text: I really wish it were made of a material that could be sanitized in the dishwasher. I had to get a second one because the first warped even on the top rack with no hat dry. Other than that, this is perfect. Easy to clean, large enough to last a few days and has a built in ant moat. Amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: Work fine. This replaced a flower shaped 8oz, 4 port feeder with bee guards because it held more. Unfortunately, while it did not leak or cause any major issues, the wasps and ants seemed to be more prevalent on the feeder. It did clean well, but in the end, I went back to the smaller, 8oz feeder.
customer_reviews.author: keychain joe

customer_reviews.title: Well made Hummingbird Feeder!
customer_reviews.text: Altogether, I've purchased four of these feeders. They're not only made of sturdy plastic but they hold three cups of sugar water. They're easy to clean and fill. I have even MORE hummers than before because of this great little feeder! I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Parker's Place

customer_reviews.title: One day before the fights started
customer_reviews.text: We wondered if there were any hummingbirds nearby. Less than a day after hanging this feeder, it was clear that we have hummingbirds. Territorial, aggressive, hummingbirds, but that probably isn't the fault of the feeder. Feisty little birds, these hummingbirds.
customer_reviews.author: BB & T

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these locally several years ago and couldn't find another one. I was happy to see them on Amazon. The feeder is easy to clean and fill and has enough feeder ports for multiple hummingbirds when they start to swarm before migrating.The 1st one I purchased is still in great shape and will probably last for many more years of use. It has a built in ant guard. I would recommend this product to anyone who enjoys feeding hummingbirds.
customer_reviews.author: SKS Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Their ideal hummingbird feeders!
customer_reviews.text: I had two just like these! I don't have to refill them as often as the smaller ones. If you have just a few I only fill them part way when it's so hot. Don't wash with hot water the bottoms won't stay fastened! Their perfect otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: Crett

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This holds 32 oz of hummingbird nectar which is a great help to me since I'm feeding approximately 20 hummers! They consume a lot. Also, the yellow flower petals that snap over the feeder openings are just greatW in preventing sweat bees from entering the feeder base.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Works great, from the moment I put it up
customer_reviews.text: Hummingbirds come every day to drink from there. I made a syrup of 2 cups water and 1 cup powdered sugar. Nice bright color, easy to set it up and doesn’t leak.
customer_reviews.author: A Happy Somebody

customer_reviews.title: No need to spend more, this is great
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased much more expensive feeders and none have worked any better than this. HBs love it, it's very easy to clean and even has a small moat near the hangar. I still suggest a bigger moat, but it got me through until mine arrived. The canister is very thin plastic, but it doesn't impede function. Feeding tray twists apart easily. If you use a 3/4 cup measure and the standard 4-1 water-cane sugar recipe, that will fill it nicely. Hook is on the small side, but comes off if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Starhuckster

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this hummingbird feeder for many years and always have birds. Finally thought it would be a good idea to try some extras, success, more birds. The colors are perfect and the birds can sit or flap their wings while eating. They are so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Finally, One that draws the birds
customer_reviews.text: We have spent so much money on bad hummingbird feeders that are either to hard to fill or clean or the birds ignore them. This is the best we have found. Easy to clean easy to fill and the birds love it!
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Love my hummingbirds. Had to buy this one because my one cup feeder was being drained every 3 days. Only thing I didn't like was the plastic hook it came with. Replaced it with a metal on to make she it stays in place. Other then that the birds love it :)
customer_reviews.author: Katerina W.

customer_reviews.title: Our hummers!!!
customer_reviews.text: I already have one of these feeders and wanted a second so I could change it out and not make our hummers wait while I cleaned and refilled it! (I know..... spoiled brats, they are!! LOL) I've bought this same feeder for daughter/son/and friend. You simply can't beat this by First Nature!!! = )
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Quality Feeder
customer_reviews.text: A really well built and thought out design in this feeder. We're happy with it! Judging by other feeders we have owned that were very successful in attracting the little birds, this feeder should work well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yellow flowers attract bees!
customer_reviews.text: All the yellow flowers are an attraction for bees - thought it was so nice until it turned into a bee feeder!
customer_reviews.author: Rc Esq.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t🙅‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably bad. The product screw/connection between the base and liquid container is very flawed: it’s broken off while hanging w/ <1/2 inch of nectar inside and less than <3 hummingbirds on it...Multiple times. Tested different ways in the sink and it’s a no-go. I’ve had many feeders that worked perfectly; I only got this for the yellow flowers and multiple holes. DON’T: recommend, do it, or waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: not whats pictured!
customer_reviews.text: Not whats pictured! No yellow flowers. Only tiny slats. However I thought I'd give it a try and painted white pedals around each feeding hole. Hummingbirds love it and its easier to clean than the one with the yellow flowers which I had last year. Only 4 stars instead of 5 because it wasn't what was pictured.
customer_reviews.author: tabasco001

customer_reviews.title: The bees will enjoy it more!
customer_reviews.text: After a month or so we are getting swarms of honey bees on this style feeder. But we never had the issue on other models previously. We even tried the netting from onion bags in between the flowers. No good
customer_reviews.author: GuruLee

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeder
customer_reviews.text: It is plastic, which was stated, but glass would have been better. Took me a few to figure out how to get the bottom apart. Not hard once I figured it out, but some sort of diagram would have been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Cushing

product_meta.title: First Nature 3090 32-ounce Hummingbird Flower Feeder
product_meta.description: Color:MulticolorFirst Nature, a birding products Company, was founded in 2001 the line has Grown to include an assortment of best-selling seed feeders, waterer, hummingbird feeders & easy-to-use hummingbird nectar. First Nature products feature unique & Patented designs that really attract the Birds & make feeding birds easier & even more enjoyable.
feature_bullets: The bright red color attracts the most inquisitive hummingbirds
With easy-to-fill wide-mouth jar Reservoirs and two-parts bases, First Nature hummingbird feeders are the easiest feeder on the market to clean
The feeding ports will accommodate several hummer's at a time
With First Nature hummingbird nectar concentrate, you can mix the correct proportions right in the feeder jar

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,348 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
